## getFreePort() function

Returns a free TCP port on the local IP address specified by the host parameter.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function getFreePort({ host }: {
    host: string;
}): Promise<number>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  { host } | { host: string; } |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;number&gt;

An unused port number chosen by the operating system.

## Remarks

This function internally creates a TCP server with port 0 so that, as mentioned in the [node.js documentation](https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v15.x/docs/api/net.html#net_server_listen_port_host_backlog_callback)<!-- -->, the operating system can assign an arbitrary unused port. The function then closes the server and returns the port number.
